createenergycannons.ponder.tag.energy_ca: Powerful energy-based weaponry powered by Forge Energy
createenergycannons.ponder.energy_mount_: Setting Up an Energy Cannon Mount
Energy Cannon Mounts work like CBC Cannon Mounts
See Create Big Cannons 'Operating Cannons' for controls
Place the Energy Cannon Mount on a shaft
Connect a Forge Energy source - this is required!
Build a cannon 2 blocks above the mount
Toggle the assembly lever to assemble the cannon
Toggle the other lever to fire!
Energy cannons need Forge Energy (FE) to fire
Rail Guns: 20,000 FE per barrel block per shot
Coil Guns: 10,000 FE per barrel block per shot
Lasers: 5 FE per tick while firing
If there isn't enough energy, the cannon won't fire
Laser Cannons are single-block energy weapons
No barrel needed - just the laser block and a mount!
The beam breaks blocks in its path!
It also damages entities in the beam!
Use CBC controls to aim the laser
createenergycannons.ponder.magnetic_cann: Magnetic cannons use electromagnetic acceleration instead of powder
Start with a CBC breech and chamber as usual
Railgun barrel blocks act as the cannon barrel
Use standard CBC projectiles - load through the breech
IMPORTANT: Projectiles MUST have a Magnetic Sled attached!
After firing, barrel blocks overheat for 25 seconds!
Firing while overheated will cause a catastrophic misfire!
More barrel blocks = higher velocity but more energy cost
createenergycannons.ponder.magnetic_sled: Energy cannons REQUIRE a Magnetic Sled on all projectiles!
Without a Magnetic Sled, the cannon simply won't fire
Start with any CBC projectile (shells, AP shells, etc)
Right-click the shell with a Magnetic Sled
The Magnetic Sled is now attached - ready for energy cannons!
Load the sledded projectile into the breech like normal
createenergycannons.ponder.railgun_vs_co: 20,000 FE per barrel block per shot
Higher velocity but expensive - and overheats!
10,000 FE per barrel block per shot - half the cost!
Lower velocity - but also overheats for 25 seconds!
BOTH types overheat - plan your shots carefully!
